com.roman.procopenco.codewars

Class BraceChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.roman.procopenco.codewars.BraceChecker

  • public class BraceChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    https://www.codewars.com/kata/valid-braces/java
    Write a function that takes a string of braces, and determines if the order of the braces is valid. It should return true if the string is valid, and false if it's invalid.

    This Kata is similar to the Valid Parentheses Kata, but introduces new characters: brackets [], and curly braces {}. Thanks to @arnedag for the idea!

    All input strings will be nonempty, and will only consist of parentheses, brackets and curly braces: ()[]{}.

    What is considered Valid? A string of braces is considered valid if all braces are matched with the correct brace.

    Examples "(){}[]" => True "([{}])" => True "(}" => False "[(])" => False "[({})](]" => False

      Checks if the closing brace is valid, based on the opening one added to stack.
      static boolean isValid(java.lang.String braces)
      Imperative solution, that uses a stack to add all opening braces and pop al closing ones.

      Imperative solution, that uses a stack to add all opening braces and pop al closing ones.

      • isValid

        public static boolean isValid(java.lang.String braces)
        Imperative solution, that uses a stack to add all opening braces and pop al closing ones. The algorithm checks.
        Parameters:
        braces - string of braces.
        Returns:
        order of braces is valid or not.

      • isClosingValid

        private static boolean isClosingValid(java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Character> bracesMap,
                                      java.util.Deque deque,
                                      java.lang.Character closingCharacter)
        Checks if the closing brace is valid, based on the opening one added to stack.
        Parameters:
        bracesMap - map with braces, key as opening brace and value as closing brace.
        deque - stack with braces
        closingCharacter - last closing character.
        Returns:
        if closing bracket is valid or not.

        Parameters:
        braces - string of braces.
        Returns:
        order of braces is valid or not.
